title: What Are the Symbols and Meanings of Different Alchemical Elements and Compounds?
first_phrase: In the previous section, the text explored the concepts of Zolfo, Magnesia, and Calamita in alchemy, highlighting their importance in the manipulation of cosmic matter. In the last part (tokens 148-151), the text further explains the properties of these elements. Zolfo is described as having a specific taste and producing foul-smelling air, which is a sign of proper manipulation. Magnesia, on the other hand, is the animal combustible that can only be understood in this context, and its development into Sulfur is only possible through the combustion of the vital magnesia. Lastly, the concept of Aria in alchemy is defined as the circulatory space of the first emanations of the mercurial corruption spirit, not to be confused with the colors of the stone.

last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding the symbolism and terminology used in alchemy requires a deep knowledge of classical authors and their works. Whether discussing the fixation and persistence of fiery states or the circulation of initial emanations, the language of alchemy is complex and nuanced. Only through careful study and reflection can one begin to unlock the secrets of this ancient tradition.
